title: BlockWorld-Repairs Dataset & Models
subtitle: Code, models and dataset for paper
description: Code and models for the paper 'Repairs in a Block World: A New Benchmark for Handling User Corrections with Multi-Modal Language Models' published at EMNLP 2024. It includes the dataset of human dialogues and annotations, see paper for more details.

title: `What are you referring to?' Evaluating Multi-Modal Dialogue Models
subtitle: Code and models for paper
description: Code for the paper '`What are you referring to?' Evaluating the Ability of Multi-Modal Dialogue Models to Process Clarificational Exchanges' published at SIGDIAL 2023 and winner of the Best Short Paper Award.

title: Exploring Multi-Modal Representations in the SIMMC 2.0 Challenge
subtitle: Code and models
description: Code and models for the paper 'Exploring Multi-Modal Representations for Ambiguity Detection & Coreference Resolution in the SIMMC 2.0 Challenge' published at AAAI 2022 DSTC10 Workshop.

title: CRWIZ
subtitle: The Intelligent Wizard Interface
description: A framework for collecting real-time Wizard-of-Oz dialogues through crowd-sourcing for collaborative, complex tasks. This framework uses semi-guided dialogue to avoid interactions that breach procedures and processes only known to experts, while enabling the capture of a wide variety of interactions. It resides on Slurk (Schlangen et al., 2018). For more information, check the the conference publication in LREC 2020 and website below.

title: MIRIAM
subtitle: The Multimodal Interface
description: MIRIAM allows operators to interrogate autonomous underwater vehicle's actions and status in real time through natural language chat. This was developed as part of an internship in 2017. I still work on it and I have added many features like speech-recognition, speech-to-text, etc. The BBC wrote an article about it: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-edinburgh-east-fife-54282984

title: Explainable MIRIAM
subtitle: Explainable Autonomy through Natural Language
description: Extension to MIRIAM so it is able to predict and explain the behaviours of the autonomous underwater vehicles. Enables operators to ask about unexpected events that they may not fully understand. This was merged into the main MIRIAM project due to its commercial applications once my thesis was finished.

title: Maritime Augmented Reality
subtitle: SeeByte Ltd
description: A cross-platform augmented reality program to monitor underwater vehicles in real-time through a camera. I developed this during my placement at SeeByte (June - December 2018).

title: Data Validation
subtitle: Automatic validation of bike geometries
description: A Python package for validating bike geometries and calculating missing parameters using maths.

title: This Website!
subtitle: A CV as a website
description: I built this website using React and SASS (Syntactically Awesome Style Sheets). Hosted in GitHub pages, it is front-end only, but all the data displayed is dynamically loaded, without using a server!

title: PurpleSky
subtitle: Employee Allocation Website
role: Lead Software Developer and Team Manager
description: Website for a year-long group project during my 3rd Year at Heriot-Watt University. It involved students from different courses. The team and I achieved 2nd place and obtained a prize for it.

title: Blackout Machine
subtitle: Simple game for Android
description: Simple roulette game for Android devices that integrates with the Facebook API. It was for a small company in Spain. The code is not actively developed anymore.
